trans-unit.source: A behavior that adds a workflow control endpoint with a fixed configuration to the service host.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activities.Description.WorkflowInstanceManagementBehavior"></xref> class.

An implementation of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior.AddBindingParameters(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription,System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint},System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection)"></xref> method.
The service description.
The service host.
The service endpoints.
The binding parameters.

An implementation of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior.ApplyDispatchBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription,System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase)"></xref> method.
The service description.
The service host.
The fixed workflow control relative endpoint address.
This address is appended to the base address of the service to create the control endpoint address.
Gets the binding for the workflow instance control endpoint when the HTTP protocol is used.
The binding is automatically created based on the protocols configured for the service host’s base address.
Messages sent to the workflow instance control endpoint do not contain any personally identifiable information and therefore it need not be encrypted.
Messages sent to the workflow control endpoint need to contain the user identity to use for authorization.
When the HTTP protocol is enabled, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> is used with the following settings.
Transaction flow is enabled.
Security mode is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode.Message>.
Windows client credentials are used.
The binding for the workflow instance control endpoint.
Gets the binding for the workflow instance control endpoint when the net.pipe protocol is used.
The binding is automatically created based on the protocols configured for the service host’s base address.
Messages sent to the workflow instance control endpoint do not contain any personally identifiable information and therefore it need not be encrypted.
Messages sent to the workflow control endpoint need to contain the user identity to use for authorization.
When the net.pipe protocol is enabled, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding> is used with the following settings.
Transaction flow is enabled.
Security mode is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeSecurityMode.Transport>.
Transport security level is set to <xref:System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel.Sign>.
Windows client credentials are used.
The binding for the workflow instance control endpoint.
An implementation of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior.Validate(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription,System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase)"></xref> method.
The service description.
The service host.
Gets or sets the Windows group of users authorized to use the workflow instance control endpoint.
Defaults to "BUILTIN\Administrators".
Valid settings are: a local Windows group or a Windows domain.
The Windows group of users authorized to use the workflow instance control endpoint.
